definition: to pry open or apart/to spread (sth) open with both hands

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: If the car door is pushed aside, ask the locked passengers to close the door.
sentences.chinese: 如轿门已被扒开，让被困乘客关上轿门。

sentences.english: The bear clawed snow, hey, snow has a sweet potato.
sentences.chinese: 小熊扒开雪，嘿，雪底下有一只白薯。

sentences.english: The small white rabbit clawed through the snow, hey, snow has two radish.
sentences.chinese: 小白兔扒开雪，嘿，雪底下有两个萝卜。

sentences.english: Carefully push aside those, was to mow to harm her face.
sentences.chinese: 小心的扒开那些草丛，未免割伤了她的脸蛋。

sentences.english: So she unbolted the door, and told her to come in.
sentences.chinese: 于是她扒开门的插销，叫她进来。
